lexUnit.name: stomp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tread heavily and noisily, typically in order to show anger.

sentence.text: Jim had stomped downstairs wiping the blood off his face with a handkerchief and later it had been Jo and Lisa who had packed his bags and told him never to come back to the house .
I heard her stomp downstairs , stop , shout back : ` And do n't forget your prayers .
Not a battleaxe exactly but I hear she used to stomp around the place in clogs and speak her mind without fear or hesitation .
The game begins with an animated sequence showing the Baron stomping around his laboratory , setting up the experiment .
Mr Sharif , meanwhile , is stomping around the country , vowing to get rid of the president when he gets back into power .
Edwina Currie rightly criticised Mr Major for stomping around in a Barbour jacket .
We kept our mouths shut and Mandeville and Southgate stomped away .
Lewis stomped away along the tide-line , kicking at the odd piece of driftwood and the occasional plastic bottle .
As Lord Westbourne stomped back in , in a thoroughly bad temper , one more shock awaited him .
His voice followed her as she stomped back to the cabin , but she was not listening .
We stomped down the stone steps to collect our sacks and made for the Upper Tier of the crag .
Darius stomps down the three steps without saying a word .
If , however , Gavin had stomped in and told her she was a piece of shit , would the audience with the Goddess Of Tedium have lasted for more than one sentence ?
Anyway , we spent the whole round with Tom stomping off and me scurrying alongside him trying to keep up .
At the end of the track the drummer throws down his sticks in disgust and stomps off -- pretty punk rock or what ?
But he stomps off to have a think now and then .
` I have nothing to say , " he said and stomped off .
` Oh , fuck you ! " shouted Martin , and stomped off to the spare room .
He compromised by stomping off to the police boat , and allowing whoever so willed to follow .
But if he went stomping by without saying anything it was a clear indication of trouble ahead .
Alex stomped by and declined to join them for an early morning cocktail .
But on waking she pushed these resolutely aside and stomped out to do her good deeds .
` I need a drink , " Tammuz said , and stomped over to the liquor cabinet he kept there .
She stomped over to the window beside Blanche , her voice suddenly strident with anger and sadness .
` Ah Christ , " he says , leaving her and stomping round the room .
Sometimes the tribe 's Big'uns recognised their old leader as he stomped up and down the battle lines bawling at his lads .
Out of the office stereo it churned and stomped , causing a ripple of bemused interest .
I was feeling pretty angry with her as I stomped across that big field , but when I reached her my heart just melted .
Viewed from an overhead perspective , Rufus can stomp from block to block with impunity but falls to his death if he makes a wrong move .
Kevin looked furious as he stomped into his office .
The only noise one hears at Edgware Road this morning is that of embittered commuters stomping away from locked gates and cursing as they plan alternative routes .
The boy turned and stomped away from him into the kitchen .
The guy we now know is called Casey stomps out of the phonebox and glares up the road in our direction so hard you could swear he sees us .
Every time I heard the wind rustling in the bushes or rattling the slates I 'd duck down under the covers , thinking of hooded ghosts stomping through the garden -- or through the wall .

Maggie kept catching her eye with an expression of knowing amusement , but at the same time she obviously hated having these men stomping through her every possession and destroying any remaining magic in her secret chamber .
He glared at Yanto with genuine dislike as he stomped through the front porch of the pub .
The foreman yelled something to the ceiling in another language and stomped toward the door saying , ` The whole world is crazy , I tell you .
Harq Obispal and entourage were stomping towards their many-finned ship .
Gordon notices a tangle of walkers stomping towards us .
Mr Trotter breathed heavily as he brushed past his wife and stomped heavily up the stairs .
